I am puzzled by the result of band pruning in Figure 3: Example point selec=
tion in two dimensions, from Evolving the Placement and Density of Neurons =
in the HyperNEAT Substrate.  It seems like the information inherent in the =
image should include points along the black-white edge of the outer black r=
egion, but band pruning removes them all.  The figure explains "In effect, =
the CPPN speaks a language through its pattern that denotes exactly which w=
eights within the hypercube should be expressed."  I am curious why "langua=
ge" is used here.  

My goal is to add iterated ES-HyperNEAT to the C++ ver=
sion at https://github.com/MisterTea/HyperNEAT.  I am presently a hobbyist =
(my profession is embedded software engineering) but considering to someday=
 pursue a PhD involving HyperNEAT, etc.

Thanks,
Tony Wilson
